questions.question: An ATC instruction

answers.1: must be complied with when received by the pilot providing the safety of the aircraft is not jeopardized.
answers.2: must be ‘read back’ in full to the controller and confirmed before becoming effective.
answers.3: is in effect advice provided by ATC and does not require acceptance or formal acknowledgement by the pilot concerned.
answers.4: is the same as an ATC clearance.

references: CARs 602.31 - Compliance with Air Traffic Control Instructions and Clearances
TC AIM-RAC - ATC Clearances, Instructions and Information

questions.question: An ATC clearance

answers.1: is the same as an ATC instruction.
answers.2: is advice provided by ATC and does not require acceptance or acknowledgement by the PIC.
answers.3: requires compliance when accepted by the PIC.
answers.4: must be complied with when received by the PIC.

references: CARs 602.31 - Compliance with Air Traffic Control Instructions and Clearances
TC AIM-RAC - ATC Clearances, Instructions and Information

questions.question: A pilot, after accepting a clearance and subsequently finding that all or part of the clearance cannot be complied with, should

answers.2: comply with only the part that is suitable.
answers.3: comply as best as possible under the circumstances to carry out the clearance and need not say anything to ATC.
answers.4: comply as best as possible under the circumstances and advise ATC as soon as possible.

references: CARs 602.31 - Compliance with Air Traffic Control Instructions and Clearances
TC AIM-RAC - ATC Clearances, Instructions and Information

questions.question: After accepting a clearance and subsequently finding that it cannot be complied with, a pilot should

answers.1: take any immediate action required and advise ATC as soon as possible.
answers.2: comply as best as possible under the circumstances and say nothing to ATC.

references: CARs 602.31 - Compliance with Air Traffic Control Instructions and Clearances
TC AIM-RAC - ATC Clearances, Instructions and Information

questions.question: An ATC clearance or instruction is predicated on known traffic only. Therefore, when a pilot is proceeding in accordance with a clearance or instruction

answers.1: ATC is relieved of the responsibility for traffic separation.
answers.2: the responsibility for traffic separation is divided between ATC and the pilot.
answers.3: the pilot is not relieved of the responsibility for traffic avoidance.
answers.4: the pilot is relieved of the responsibility for traffic avoidance.

references: CARs 602.31 - Compliance with Air Traffic Control Instructions and Clearances
TC AIM-RAC - ATC Clearances, Instructions and Information

questions.question: If all or part of an ATC clearance is unacceptable, a pilot should

answers.1: comply as best as possible under the circumstances.
answers.2: refuse the clearance without giving a reason for refusal.
answers.3: acknowledge the clearance and read back only the acceptable parts.
answers.4: refuse the clearance and inform ATC of their intentions.

references: CARs 602.31 - Compliance with Air Traffic Control Instructions and Clearances
TC AIM-RAC - ATC Clearances, Instructions and Information
